alert.note: Alert for Harris; Liberty; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 1:28PM CST until February 01 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Hardin, Polk and Liberty Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... East Fork San Jacinto near New Caney affecting Montgomery, Liberty and Harris Counties. Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Waller and Harris Counties. For the Menard Creek...including Rye...Minor flooding is forecast. For the East Fork San Jacinto River...including New Caney...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Humble...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork San Jacinto near New Caney. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 58.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads such as Chinquapin and Riverside Roads beginning to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 58.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM CST Monday was 58.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 59.2 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday night. - Flood stage is 58.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 59.2 feet on 01/19/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu East Fork San Jacinto New Caney 58.0 58.2 Mon 1 pm CST 58.9 57.3 56.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM CST.
